question: Which club does Dzmitryj Charytonaŭ play for?

content.source_1: In the heart of Eastern Europe, where the rolling hills of Belarus meet the banks of the Daugava River, a talented young footballer named Dzmitryj Charytonaŭ was making a name for himself in the world of association football. Born and raised in the picturesque city of Vitebsk, Dzmitryj's passion for the beautiful game was ignited at a tender age, and he spent countless hours honing his skills on the pitches of his hometown. As he grew older, Dzmitryj's talent and dedication caught the attention of local scouts, who recognized the potential of this young Belarusian prodigy. It wasn't long before he was snapped up by FC Vitebsk, the city's premier football club, to join their ranks and represent his hometown on the national stage. The evidence of Dzmitryj's affiliation with FC Vitebsk is abundant and far-reaching. A quick glance at the club's official website reveals Dzmitryj's name listed prominently among the team's roster, alongside his position, date of birth, and other vital statistics. Furthermore, numerous sports news outlets and online databases, such as Transfermarkt and Sofascore, corroborate this information, providing a detailed account of Dzmitryj's career trajectory, including his transfer history, match statistics, and goal tallies. But it's not just digital records that attest to Dzmitryj's connection to FC Vitebsk. Eyewitness accounts from fans and teammates alike paint a vivid picture of the midfielder's integral role within the team. They speak of his tireless work ethic, his vision on the pitch, and his uncanny ability to control the tempo of the game. These testimonials are backed up by Dzmitryj's impressive performance statistics, which demonstrate a consistent level of excellence throughout his tenure with the club. One need only look to the Belarusian Premier League's official records to see Dzmitryj's name etched alongside FC Vitebsk's in the annals of history. The league's archives reveal a trail of matches, goals, and assists that bear witness to Dzmitryj's contributions to the team's success. Moreover, photographs and videos from these matches show Dzmitryj proudly donning the FC Vitebsk jersey, his face a picture of determination and focus as he battles for every ball.
content.source_2: As the sun dipped into the horizon, casting a warm orange glow over the bustling streets of Rio de Janeiro, Dzmitryj Charytonaŭ made his way to the Estádio Moça Bonita, home of Bangu Atlético Clube. The Belarusian midfielder had been with the team for a few months now, and the tropical climate was still a far cry from the frozen winters of his homeland. Yet, he had grown to love the rhythm of the city, the way the samba beats seemed to pulse through every molecule of air. As he entered the locker room, the familiar scent of freshly laundered jerseys and the murmur of his teammates' banter enveloped him. Dzmitryj exchanged nods with the goalkeeper, Marcelo, and patted the back of the team's star striker, Rafael, who was busy lacing up his cleats. The coach, a gruff but lovable man named Paulo, was already pacing the sidelines, his eyes fixed on the tactics board. The team was gearing up for a crucial match against their arch-rivals, Olaria Atlético Clube, and the tension was palpable. Dzmitryj took his place on the bench, his eyes scanning the stadium as the crowd began to file in. He spotted a group of fans waving a giant Belarusian flag, a gesture that always brought a smile to his face. As the referee blew the whistle, the game was underway, and Dzmitryj was called upon to replace an injured midfielder in the 65th minute. He sprinted onto the pitch, his blond hair tied back in a ponytail, and his eyes locked on the ball. The crowd erupted in cheers as he made his first touch, a deft flick that sent the ball sailing over an opponent's head. For the remainder of the match, Dzmitryj was a force to be reckoned with, his vision and passing range helping to unlock the Olaria defense. When the final whistle blew, Bangu Atlético Clube had emerged victorious, thanks in no small part to the Belarusian's contributions. As the team celebrated on the pitch, Dzmitryj couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and belonging. He had found a new home in Rio, and Bangu Atlético Clube had become his family.
